name: Marriott's Aruba Surf Club

reviews.title: Can't wait to come back to the Surf Club
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a wonderful first visit to Aruba. We are time share owners at the Marriott St. Thomas Frenchmans' Cove resort and traded in our week this year. Although we prefer the rooms at St. Thomas, we feel that the overall experience in Aruba is tough to beat. There are many good restaurants on the island. Our favorite was Madame Jeanettes. This will be a must visit on every trip. As previous reviews have mentioned, the Surf Club is a large resort. The biggest challenge for me was waking up at 6:45 a.m. every morning to get down and reserve beach chairs for my wife and I. Although I am not a morning person, this was not too difficult because we were both worn on from the sun by 10 p.m. each night. Our favorite spot was near the pool closest to the beach. There are a lot of chairs, but if you want to get a preferred seat, important to wake up early. After eating breakfast and working out, we would come back down after 9 a.m. The lazy river rocks. Although you can purchase tubes at the resort, we brought down a pump and inflatible water chair which I purchased at Walmart for $7.00. Only island that I have seen where people use the tubes in the ocean as well. Very relaxing. Upon check-in, we immediately took a cab to the Ling and Sons grocery store. There is always a cab waiting at the Surf club. Spent $150.00 U.S. for a week's worth of breakfast, some lunch meals, snacks, and alcohol. Not too bad. Overall, it was an amazing week. Nice to have the Ocean Club and Marriott Hotel next door. We typically gambled at the Marriott and the Hyatt down the beach. We are looking forward to our next trip to the Surf Club.

My family and 3 year old daughter spent 8 days at the Aruba Surf Club. We had a wonderful room with a great ocean view. It was one of the two bedroom villas with full kitchen. We enjoyed every minute of our stay. The pool was great. Always plenty of chairs around. And you can't beat the lazy river. We could float in there for hours. We went to the local grocery store Ling and Sons to stock up on some groceries to get us by for lunches. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. No complaints here. Can't wait to go back in the next year or two.
reviews.title: Loved this resort! Will go back soon...

reviews.text: Went to relax with few expectations. Went at the end of busy season- can see how it could be overcrowded at times because still very busy at this time.
reviews.title: Pluses and Minuses- sort it out for yourself
Marriott Surf club
reviews.text: Applause to hotel.

Although did not take part in or inquire about prices- Many watersport options. Free options include a lazy river and beach access. Cost options include parasailing, windsailing, tubing, jet skiiing- and everyone looked like they were having a great time
reviews.title: Marriott Aruba Surf Club Is Excellent

reviews.text: We went for a quick trip to Aruba for a break from our spring snow storms, and found both the island and the Marriot to be wonderful. We stayed at the marriot surf club and found everyone from the bellmen, frontdesk staff, concierge, housekeeping, and even hotel security to be extremely pleasent and nice.
reviews.title: Great place in a beautiful setting

reviews.text: The pools there were great but I would recommend getting up early to get a chair by the pool but the ocean was where we spent most of our time and it really wasn't that hard to find chairs on the beach. They do provide chair tags so it is easy to save your chair but get up early. They also provided beach towels that could be turned in every day for fresh towels which was great because you never had to worry about sandy towels.
reviews.title: Great vacation!!! Iignore the negative reviews......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I had anything neggative to say it would be that drinks and food around the pool area were pretty expensive for what you got. We went to the local supermarket and found it really not anymore expensive than resort areas in the US. We simply stocked up on food and booze the first day we were there and then bought drinks and snacks to the beach with us. Your room depending on what size will have a full sized kitchen or a kitchenette which helped us keep cost of food down.
reviews.title: Huge resort and a fun lazy river

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all this place is great. We would deffinetly go back to aruba and stay at the marriot surf club.
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.text: i spent 9 nights at the MSF from 4/28-5/7/09. I had been reading the reviews on this website for almost the last year, and honestly, I was really nervous about my choice of resorts based on those reviews. IGNORE THEM....GO AND JUDGE FOR YOURSELF!
reviews.title: You need to stay two weeks in Aruba to justify the trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We exchange our timeshare to stay at the Marriott Surf Club from Sunday, May 24 through Friday, May 29...the week of Memorial Day. We stayed in the Lighthouse Tower, the one closest to the beach. We were on the 9th floor, room 6919.
reviews.title: Very Nice Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is really nice. It can get crowded at the pool. So we tagged our chairs in the mornings. On days we didn't tag because we were doing somehing else in the morning, we did not have problems finding a chair around 2pm.
reviews.title: it's a timeshare stupid!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a one bedroom unit, which we traded through our timeshare. The room and facility are immaculate. We never signed up for a palapa on the beach. We used the beach chairs with the tarp for shade. There are workers on the beach that pull the chairs out and place them where ever you like.
reviews.title: loved the resort

reviews.text: I will agree with previous TA posters that the beach in front of the Marriott properties is definitely different from some of the other hotels. It felt slimy when you walked in. I intentionally didn't tell my husband about the slime. He described it as soft. It didn't both him. I walked the beach from the Marriott up to Rui Palace and there's definitely a difference. The sand is firmer in other places. I never smelled anything...as other travelers have mentioned.
reviews.title: the perfect place to relax and to be spoiled!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: We had a rental car. We never had a problem finding a place to park. Parking on site is free. The lazy river was great. We brought tubes with us from Target...only $3 bucks. Bring your own. We went to Ling and Sons for groceries. We had breakfast and lunch in the room daily and splurged for dinner. My husband used the grills on site to make some burgers one day. He enjoyed the gym and the basketball court as well. There was free internet in the room, but the hookup only stretched from the kitchen to the bar area. So I couldn't use my laptop just anywhere in the villa. It wasn't a big problem though.
reviews.title: We are in love with Aruba

reviews.text: This place is beautiful. The water was clean, no smell as others had reported here. The chairs were reserved with tags, fair for all. The pool security was always around and would make sure the chairs were being used in two hours. It was a wonderful experience all around.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back last night from a week at the Aruba Marriott Surf Club. We have stayed at the Ocean Club next door and now, after comparing, must say, we prefer Ocean Club. Being empty nesters, we prefer the calmness of Ocean Club. Don't get me wrong, I LOVE babies, I adore them, I can't wait for grandchildren!! I often babysit for my friends that have little ones. And I'm not knocking the Surf Club for being so "baby friendly." In fact, I think it is fabulous that they are so "baby friendly". If you are looking for a place to go and you have really little ones, this is the place to go!! I was really amazed that so many people travel with LITTLE babies. I'm not talking about children, I am talking about babies in strollers and/or in their mother's arms. One couple even had triplets, another had twins. It is hard enough to get myself packed for a trip. I applaud all those parents that can travel so far with little ones and all the paraphenalia that goes with them. I'm just trying to get a point across that at Surf Club you will see lots of babies and I'm sure once school gets out, there will be more babies and children.
reviews.title: Babies,babies,everywhere :) (lol)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lazy River is great for kids and adults alike. I have also never seen so many adults using what I used to call "inner tubes" to play with. I felt like a little girl again. All the different colors of tubes in the ocean was really pretty.
reviews.title: Paradise in the Sun

reviews.text: The Surf Club was very crowded around the pool, every chair was taken and you are sitting right next to your neighbor, and this is not even peak season, so I cannot imagine what it is like during peak season. Palapas on the beach are nice, but as others have mentioned you do either have to get up early to reserve one, or you have to stand in line at 4pm the day before to get one. There is just no good system to get one.
reviews.title: Love our room; customer service not great...

reviews.text: Our room was on the 10th floor and we did have a good view of the ocean and the homes, lights, hills, stretching out behind the beach. The downside was that we faced the Ocean Club and their air conditioning condensers made a lot of ongoing steady "white" noise. And the dumpsters were below us, so we had to sit through that every morning, which took away from the joy of sitting on our balcony and trying to enjoy eating. They timed it perfectly each day, lol! We really could not get any "peace" on our balcony, which was a shame because the view was actually breathtaking.
reviews.title: Fabulous beach vacation

aka: Marriott`s Aruba Surf Club Hotel Palm/Eagle Beach
